title: Nygard's lawyer asks Canada court to reconsider extradition
description: Lawyers for Canadian fashion mogul Peter Nygard have asked the Manitoba Court of Appeal to reconsider a United States extradition order, citing concerns over the Nygard’s health if he were to serve time in the U.S. Nygard’s lawyers were in court to argue against three issues in the order

title: Americans and other foreigners struggle to flee Sudan amid fierce fighting
description: The U.S. has evacuated its diplomats and their families, but about 16,000 other American citizens remain.

title: El Salvador tries ex-leader Funes in absentia for gang truce
description: El Salvador opened a trial Wednesday against former President Mauricio Funes alleging that he had negotiated a truce with the country’s powerful street gangs when he was president, but the trial will proceed without Funes who lives in Nicaragua

title: 102-year-old convicted Nazi camp guard dies awaiting appeal
description: German news agency dpa reported Wednesday that a 102-year-old man who was convicted last year on more than 3,500 counts of accessory to murder for serving as a guard at a Nazi concentration camp during World War II has died

title: Haiti police condemn vigilante killings amid gang violence
description: Police are pledging to crack down on unrelenting gang violence that has paralyzed swaths of Haiti’s capital, and are pleading with Haitians to end a string of grisly vigilante killings

title: Argentina: A desperate search for a door as currency tumbles
description: Antonela Massarelli desperately needed a front door for a new house she and her family will be moving into this weekend in a Buenos Aires suburb

title: Russia can fund war in Ukraine for another year despite sanctions, leaked document says
description: In previously unreported, leaked U.S. documents, senior Russian officials, intelligence agencies and oligarchs fret over sanctions — and work around them.

title: Mexico rights agency slams 10 states for HIV marriage bans
description: Mexico’s governmental human rights commission has called on ten of the country’s 32 states to get rid of old laws that ban marriage between people with “chronic, incurable, hereditary or contagious diseases” saying that could discriminate against the HIV-positive or people living with AIDS

title: World powers pull their citizens as violence roils Sudan
description: World powers evacuated more people from Sudan on Wednesday in complex international operations prompted by an eruption of fighting that has sent thousands of foreigners and many more Sudanese people fleeing for safety

title: Kenya cult death toll rises to 95 as government sets curfew
description: The latest death toll in Kenya’s cult investigation has risen to 95 as the government announced a dusk-to-dawn curfew on the ranch owned by a pastor who is accused of ordering his followers to fast to death

title: World Food Program adds hot meals to Venezuela operations
description: The food assistance agency of the United Nations says it is expanding operations in Venezuela by providing hot meals to 16,000 children and adults in more than 100 schools

title: UK court: Jehovah's Witnesses not liable for rape by elder
description: The U.K. Supreme Court has ruled that the Jehovah’s Witnesses organization isn’t liable for an elder who raped a member of his congregation

title: USMCA commission to open environmental probe of Mexico train
description: The trilateral Commission for Environmental Cooperation established by the U.S., Mexico and Canada has recommended opening an investigation into Mexico’s multibillion-dollar tourist train project on the Yucatán peninsula

title: Brazil's Bolsonaro giving testimony to police on Jan. 8 riot
description: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro has arrived at the Federal Police headquarters to give testimony about his actions before the Jan. 8 attacks on government buildings in capital Brasilia

title: Ukrainian President Zelensky holds ‘meaningful’ call with China’s Xi Jinping
description: The phone call Wednesday was the first conversation between the Ukrainian president and the Chinese leader since Russia's invasion in February 2022.

title: UN says at least 55 migrants drowned in shipwreck off Libya
description: A rubber boat carrying dozens of Europe-bound migrants has sunk off the coast of Libya and at least 55 people drowned, including women and children

title: Bavaria to make it easier to shoot wolves in Alpine region
description: Officials in Germany’s southern state of Bavaria say they want to make it easier to shoot wolves after farmers complained that their livestock on Alpine pastures are being preyed upon

title: Slovenia: Bear lightly injures dog walker, amid cull debate
description: Slovenian authorities say a bear has attacked and bitten a man walking his dog in a village south of the capital Ljubljana

title: 29 people abducted in Nigeria’s capital as attacks persist
description: A government official says at least 29 people were abducted in Nigeria’s capital territory on Tuesday, the latest such attack by gunmen amid the West African nation’s persistent security challenges

title: Pope allows women to vote at upcoming bishops' meeting
description: Pope Francis has decided to give women the right to vote at an upcoming meeting of bishops

title: More extreme heat is coming. Study shows world’s least-prepared regions.
description: Researchers say extreme heat, growing populations or limited resources put some regions at the most risk, including Afghanistan and Central America.

title: Pakistan army says 2 troops, 2 militants killed in shootout
description: The Pakistani military says an army operation in the northwest targeting militants triggered a firefight that left two soldiers and two insurgents dead

title: After the insurrection, Brazil can’t decide whom to blame
description: Former president Jair Bolsonaro, whose supporters stormed Brasília on Jan. 8 in hopes of reversing his election loss, is due to testify to federal police on Wednesday.

title: German court: naked landlord doesn't justify lower rent
description: A German court says a landlord sunbathing naked in the courtyard of his building isn’t a reason for his tenants to reduce their rental payments

title: UN agency: Afghanistan needs $4.62 billion in aid for 2023
description: The U.N.’s humanitarian affairs agency says Afghanistan needs $4.62 billion in humanitarian aid from the international community this year for nearly 24 million people in need

title: Official says Maoist rebels kill 11 in central India attack
description: An official says Maoist insurgents have detonated an explosive device in a forested area of central India, killing 10 policemen and their driver

title: Meryl Streep wins Spain's Princess of Asturias award
description: Meryl Streep has won one of Spain’s most prestigious awards in the arts for her long career of acting excellence

title: Biden to reassure South Korea’s security amid rising threat from North
description: President Biden plans to use a state visit by South Korea's Yoon Suk Yeol to launch a set of new measures aimed at publicly countering the growing nuclear threat from North Korea.

title: Iran court issues $312.9M judgment against US amid tensions
description: An Iranian court has issued a $312.9 million judgment against the United States over a 2017 Islamic State-claimed attack on Tehran

title: Prosecutors now doubt imprisoned mother killed her children
description: Prosecutors have acknowledged that new scientific evidence leaves reasonable doubt that an imprisoned Australian mother deliberately killed her four children

title: Iran says senior cleric on Assembly of Experts shot dead
description: A senior Shiite cleric in Iran has been shot and killed in an attack in a northern province along the Caspian Sea

title: EU agrees to boost green fuels for aviation, cut emissions
description: New rules requiring airlines to use more sustainable fuels across the European Union have been agreed in a bid to help decarbonize the sector

title: Sudan military: Former ruler al-Bashir in military hospital
description: Sudan’s military says former autocratic ruler Omar al-Bashir is being held in a military-run hospital, giving its first official statement on his location since violence in the capital Khartoum raised questions over his whereabouts

title: Germany: Van carrying 29 Syrians flees, hits police car
description: Police say a van carrying 29 people from Syria collided with a patrol car after its driver tried to evade a check by officers near Germany’s border with Poland

title: Thousands of sex assaults at U.K. hospitals reported since 2019, data shows
description: The Women’s Rights Network found a “jaw-dropping” number of reports of sexual assaults that allegedly took place at National Health Service hospitals in Britain.

title: Kingsolver, O'Farrell among Women's Prize fiction finalists
description: An Appalachian update on Charles Dickens and a tale told by a dolphin are among six finalists for the prestigious Women’s Prize for Fiction

title: The latest tool in China’s influence campaign: Police on social media?
description: Chinese security ministry has been linked to an influence campaign aimed at casting the United States as an irresponsible cyber power, according to a new report.

title: In photos: The story behind the Sudan crisis
description: The violent conflict between Sudan’s military factions has roots in the fall of dictator Omar Hassan al-Bashir.

title: Israeli principal in Australian court on sex convictions
description: Former Jewish girls school principal and now convicted sex offender Malka Leifer has been ordered to appear in an Australian court in June for a two-day sentencing hearing

title: Pope to visit Hungary amid diverging views on war, migrants
description: Pope Francis’ spiritual priorities will be on display during a trip to Hungary this week

title: Sudanese abroad try to extend a lifeline and aid back home
description: About 50,000 Sudanese living in the United Kingdom are worrying about loved ones still trapped by the fighting back home and are trying to do what they can to help

title: Ukraine live briefing: Rockets destroy Ukrainian museum; Russia blames West for grain deadlock
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky accused Russia of attacking a residential neighborhood and museum in Kupiansk, killing two and wounding at least 10.

title: As Assad returns to Arab fold, Syrians watch with hope, fear
description: Syrians living on opposite sides of the largely frozen battle lines dividing their country are watching the accelerating normalization of ties between the government of Bashar Assad and Syria’s neighbors through starkly different lenses

title: Panic spreads in Iran after new suspected poison attacks on girls schools
description: “Parents are really scared, and a lot of them won’t send their kids to school anymore,” an Iranian teacher told The Post.

title: Sudan factions not ready for talks, U.N. says; WHO warns of biohazard risk
description: The World Health Organization warned of “high risk of biological hazards” after a Khartoum lab with measles and polio pathogens was seized by an armed faction.

title: Kidnapped NZ pilot: Indonesian army attacks put him at risk
description: Separatist rebels in Indonesia’s restive Papua region have released a video appearing to show the New Zealand pilot they took hostage in February saying that recent Indonesian military attacks threatened his safety

title: Ukraine’s Azov brigade races to rebuild ahead of fateful fight
description: The Azov brigade achieved legendary status after its defense of Mariupol but is now seeking to rebuild ahead of the spring fighting season.

title: South Korea’s Yoon has a crucial, if awkward, summit with Biden
description: Amid fallout over the U.S. spying scandal, South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol arrives in Washington and will discuss a diverse agenda with President Biden.
